Best story game I've ever played, it actually touched my heart and made me laught on some points, it's just the best game.




Edit:
 I nominated it for the best alternate story :)

I highly recommend playing this game, maybe one of the best games in my library (don't know yet, because my taste is very weird).
Here’s a list of what I like about it:
-	Has a great history (I recommend the first one, too. Just buy the portal pack).
-	The Coop is very good and challenging for 2 persons.
-	Challenges are somewhat difficult.
-	Graphics aren’t that old for being from 2011 (On high settings)
-	Very cheap (at discount).
-	I liked the soundtrack and is free!!
My downside is that I’ll liked that the game has a coop for 2~4 persons, even that the vanilla coop levels doesn’t support it, maybe being exclusive function for some Workshop levels would’ve help it, just as Left 4 Dead. But it’s still good, and it’s not pretty much required…

11/10 ~ME

My favorite game from Valve, and surprisingly not as difficult as people said it would be.
I would rate it a 10/10. Great storyline, satisfying ending, amazing graphics, and no information needed from the first game. I would say it is worth your money and definitely should buy
Melhor historia, recomendo mt <3

Um dos jogos mais geniais criados na história dos games. Apesar de já ter fechado em outras plataformas, é o tipo de jogo que você não se cansa de jogá-lo na busca de mais nuances e detalhes. Uma ótima opção pra quem deseja uma narrativa original, desafiadora e, sobretudo, imersiva. Além disso, conta com uma excelente direção de arte, trilha sonora e desenvolvimento complexo da personalidade dos personagens.

I loved the first Portal. Played it and thought it was the best game I ever played and nothing could top it. But then Portal 2 topped it. It's 100% worth full price but it goes on sale pretty often for as little as $2 so you might as well wait. It will be the best $2 you ever spend, I guarantee. 

Unfortunately because of the kind of game that it is, there's not a heap of replay value. I have played through it twice (several years apart so I forgot half the puzzles) but not much point playing it a third time. I would happily pay full price of the game to have all memory of it wiped so I could play it again. Thankfully there are community made test chambers and a co-op that are both amazing. 

Just get it. You won't regret it.
作者脑洞奇大，游戏画质和适配特别好，期待PORTAL3

A must-have puzzle game. It's just awesome.
... and it's also one of very few games where I actually enjoy user-generated content.

So after 50 hours of playing non-stop to get 100% achievements on this game is completed, so I'm gonna give a little review on this game.

Portal 2 is one of my favorite puzzle games in existence. There are so many things that are amazing in this game that it makes it so fun and enjoyable, from the story telling, to the characters (especially Cave Johnson), and to the puzzles. The puzzles in this game make you (for the first time at least) feel like a god when beating them. There are some parts that you can get frustrated on, but it's not a "search up on Youtube for walkthrough" type of puzzle frustration. The story telling is phenomenal, for having such complex arcs and every part of the game doesn't feel like an anime episode to where one episode is supposedly connected to the plot, whereas the next episode is just an episode full of unnecessary filler and fan service. The characters are likeable and hilarious. There was never a time to where I was playing Portal 2 and felt so bad from Glados' words that I was getting annoyed. I'd always begged to have Glados insult me for her insults are one of the most enjoyable thing in this game. But what really got me loving this game more than needed is Cave Johnson. J. K. Simmons nailed a great preformance on a character we needed, and, by god, wanted. Like stated before, there is never a part in the game to where I feel the need to search up a video just to proceed. Each puzzle has a unique look, setting, and layout.

By all means, if you have not played this game, I highly recommend it, especially during the time of when this review is being made (during the Summer Sale 2018) for it being $1.99.
